SEARCH
Package sh.brane.core.crypto

Class PrivateKeySigner

java.lang.Object
sh.brane.core.crypto.PrivateKeySigner
All Implemented Interfaces:
Destroyable, Signer
public final class PrivateKeySigner extends Object implements Signer, Destroyable
Transaction signer backed by a raw private key.

This implementation uses Brane's native crypto primitives for signing.

Implements Destroyable to allow clearing sensitive key material from memory when no longer needed. Call destroy() when the signer is no longer required.

  • Method Details

    • fromPrivateKey

      public static PrivateKeySigner fromPrivateKey(PrivateKey privateKey)
      Creates a signer from an existing private key.

      Advanced API for users who already have a PrivateKey instance. Most users should use the String constructor.

      Parameters:
      privateKey - the private key (must not be null)
      Returns:
      a new signer backed by the given private key
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if privateKey is null
      Since:
      0.3.0

    • signTransaction

      public Signature signTransaction(UnsignedTransaction tx, long chainId)
      Description copied from interface: Signer
      Signs a transaction and returns the raw signature.

      The client is responsible for assembling the final signed transaction envelope.

      Specified by:
      signTransaction in interface Signer
      Parameters:
      tx - the unsigned transaction to sign
      chainId - the chain ID for replay protection
      Returns:
      the raw signature of the transaction hash

    • signMessage

      public Signature signMessage(byte[] message)
      Description copied from interface: Signer
      Signs a raw message according to EIP-191 (personal_sign).

      The implementation is responsible for prefixing the message with "Ethereum Signed Message:\n" + message.length before hashing and signing. The returned signature should have a v value of 27 or 28.

      Specified by:
      signMessage in interface Signer
      Parameters:
      message - the raw message bytes to sign (must not be null)
      Returns:
      the EIP-191 compatible signature

    • signRawHash

      public Signature signRawHash(byte[] hash)
      Signs a raw 32-byte hash directly without any prefixing.

      This is used for EIP-712 typed data signing where the hash already includes the appropriate prefix (0x19 0x01).

      Parameters:
      hash - the 32-byte hash to sign
      Returns:
      signature with v=0 or v=1
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if hash is not 32 bytes

    • signTypedData

      public Signature signTypedData(Eip712Domain domain, String primaryType, Map<String,List<TypedDataField>> types, Map<String,Object> message)
      Description copied from interface: Signer
      Signs typed data according to EIP-712.
      Specified by:
      signTypedData in interface Signer
      Parameters:
      domain - the EIP-712 domain
      primaryType - the primary type name
      types - type definitions
      message - message data
      Returns:
      signature with v=27 or v=28

    • destroy

      public void destroy()
      Destroys the underlying private key material.

      After calling this method, any attempt to use this signer will throw an IllegalStateException.

      Specified by:
      destroy in interface Destroyable
